topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559324116368726a08000ba4#post_559324116368726a08000ba4
[bq="uc9"]"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559323486368721857001302#post_559323486368721857001302
[bq="Shadow the Hedgehog"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559322926368720b66000665#post_559322926368720b66000665
How you will gonna get shot if no one can see you?

How you will gonna die of a shot if the wounds will heal?

How you will gonna die of a shot if the bullet can't penetratre the metal?

How you will gonna get tazed if the power armor is anti-static and the helmet have a rubber-like material anti-electricity?[/bq]
Thermal goggles; just cause you're invisible doesn't mean you're not giving off heat.

Shoot them in the head; shut off their body long enough that it would effectively lobotomize them. . aka why wolverine lost his memories.

Metal skeleton =/= metal skin; if they had metal skin then just electrocute them.

There are non-conductive metals, but they're absolute dog shit for protection against bullets.[/bq]
Yeah, but it will be to late to realize you needed thermal goggles to detect the invisible enemies.

AH, cause lobotomy, but don't cause death.

Metal Skeleton... well maybe yes, you can die.

Well you just put that non-conductive material inside the bulletproof metal helmet.

topics.body:
"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559325c2636872376200082c#post_559325c2636872376200082c
[bq="Shadow the Hedgehog"]Yeah, but it will be to late to realize you needed thermal goggles to detect the invisible enemies.

Well you just put that non-conductive material inside the bulletproof metal helmet. 
[/bq]
If there was someone running around named "invisible-man" and the villain didn't think to buy thermal goggles that villain has shit for brains.

Then your head wouldn't be bulletproof.

Think about it as like buying a tank; sure there's smart tanks made out of composite plastics but they're complete shit performance wise.  Tanks made out of composites are vulnerable to superheating internally.  Basically the reason why the military doesn't use composites for tanks is that the problem with them is that when it gets blown up it bakes the people inside like a oven to death.

In order for something like Iron Man to be real and physically work it would look more like a tank with legs than a suit. . . last time someone took a tank for a joy ride on the road the police were not happy.

Tl:dr; most realistic superhero would be "tank man". . . but that would get the police fucking pissed someone going around the town in effectively a walking tank.
